026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.taglets.snippet;
027
028import java.util.Collection;
029import java.util.List;
030import java.util.Map;
031import java.util.Optional;
032import java.util.stream.Collectors;
033
034/**
035 * Convenient access to attributes.
036 */
037public final class Attributes {
038
039    private final Map<String, List<Attribute>> attributes;
040
041    public Attributes(Collection<? extends Attribute> attributes) {
042        this.attributes = attributes
043            .stream()
044            .collect(Collectors.groupingBy(Attribute::name,
045                Collectors.toList()));
046    }
047
048    /*
049     * 1. If there are multiple attributes with the same name and type, it is
050     * unknown which one of these attributes will be returned.
051     *
052     * 2. If there are no attributes with this name and type, an empty optional
053     * will be returned.
054     *
055     * 3. If a non-specific (any/or/union/etc.) result is required, query for
056     * the Attribute.class type.
057     */
058    public <T extends Attribute> Optional<T> get(String name, Class<T> type) {
059        return attributes.getOrDefault(name, List.of())
060            .stream()
061            .filter(type::isInstance)
062            .map(type::cast)
063            .findAny();
064    }
065}
